dialog.text: Thanks for coming in. We are looking for a highly motivated Junior Developer who is ready to hit the ground running.
Thank you! I am really excited about the role. I have been building apps for three years now.
That is nice, but let's look at the core requirements. Do you have experience with 'HyperSwift-AI'?
Actually, yes! I started using it the day it was released last June. I even contributed to the open-source documentation.
Only since last June? That is... concerning. We are looking for a minimum of ten years of professional experience in 'HyperSwift-AI'.
But sir, the technology has only existed for fourteen months. The creator of the language doesn't even have ten years of experience in it.
I don't like excuses, it shows a lack of dedication. What about your experience with 'Quantum-React'?
Again, that came out in 2024. I have been using it since the beta.
We need twelve years for that. Plus a Master's degree in Rocket Science for this Junior position.
Wait, the job description said 'Entry Level'. The salary is listed as 'competitive', which usually means minimum wage.
It is entry-level for us. We want someone with the wisdom of a retired CEO and the soul of a hungry intern.
I feel like I am in a glitch in the matrix. How can anyone meet these criteria?
The right candidate will find a way. Perhaps by manipulating the space-time continuum? Are you a team player?
I was, until five minutes ago.
Let's move on. We have a coding test. You have three minutes to rebuild Facebook using only CSS and a calculator.
You are joking, right? Please tell me there's a hidden camera.
I don't joke about 'HyperSwift'. Now, regarding the ten years of experience...
I literally can't give you ten years of a one-year-old tech! It's mathematically impossible!
Not with that attitude it isn't. We need 'Rockstars' here.
Rockstars usually die young from the stress of people like you.
Is that a 'no' on the ten years then?
You know what? I'll go work for the guy who actually invented the language. He probably only has one year of experience too.
Fine. But you're missing out on a great opportunity to earn 'Company Equity' that will never vest.
Goodbye. Good luck finding your time-traveling Junior.
